channel.title: Sprite Question
channel.description:
If you notice, In rsc, theres 8 different ways a sprite faces,
North, North East, East, South East, South, South West, West, North West
But in the sprite files, it only has
North, North east, East, South east and South
It makes you think, how are the others shown in game, Youll probably think, to get west, youd just flip over east, to get north west, youd flip over north east and to get south west, youd flip over south east.
But no, look at the image below,
[img]http://i46.tinypic.com/6h2v53.jpg[/img]
Youl notice that the weapon should be in the opposite hand, and if there were a shield it'd need to be in the opposite hand, and in the fighting image, the other arm should be moving again, with the weapon in the opposite hand
How is this done :\

item.title: Sprite Question
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

I’m not 100% sure that this is how it’s done, but I think that the sprite layout (for items) is to have 3 sprites for each direction that are rotated based upon the player’s current torso sprite in order to make it look like the item is ‘attached’ to the player’s arm. I would assume that in order to get the ‘other half’ of the sprites that the sprite would be horizontally flipped and then have a x,y translation applied to it so that the fulcrum of the sprite/player image still appears to be in the same spot. The camera class is a bit of an ugly can of worms to open up to find out for sure.

Read full topic
